paper_title.en: The Rheological Behavior of the Nano-Meter Film of Non-Functional PFPE on Hard Disk Surfaces during Spin-Off

description.en: Spin-off experiments were conducted at different temperatures for a nonfunctional PFPE Z25 film with an initial thickness of 2.4 nm, and comparison with the diffusion experiments was carried out. It is found that PFPE Z25 shows completely different rheological behaviors in spin-off and diffusion. Theoretical model based on the Fick law of diffusion was proposed, which is called the Layer Molecular Dynamic Diffusion (LMDD) model. The proposed model results in a much better agreement with the spin-off experimental results than the continuum theory being used at present. Contrary to the results in the diffusion experiment, the nanometer film of nonfunctional PFPE Z25 also shows a layered structure in the spin-off.

paper_title.en: The Rheological Behavior of the Nano-Meter Film of Non-Functional PFPE on Hard Disk Surfaces during Spin-Off

description.en: Spin-off experiments were conducted at different temperatures for a nonfunctional PFPE Z25 film with an initial thickness of 2.4 nm, and comparison with the diffusion experiments was carried out. It is found that PFPE Z25 shows completely different rheological behaviors in spin-off and diffusion. Theoretical model based on the Fick law of diffusion was proposed, which is called the Layer Molecular Dynamic Diffusion (LMDD) model. The proposed model results in a much better agreement with the spin-off experimental results than the continuum theory being used at present. Contrary to the results in the diffusion experiment, the nanometer film of nonfunctional PFPE Z25 also shows a layered structure in the spin-off.

paper_title.en: The behavior of the liquid-like Langmuir's adsorbed film on air bearing surfaces

description.en: The contamination of slider air bearing surfaces may lead to a critical failure of hard disk drive systems. The contamination may be classified into two types: the liquid-like contamination and the particle contamination. In this study, the liquid-like contamination is concerned. It is assumed that the liquid-like contamination is caused by the adsorption of contaminant molecules in air. A mathematic model has been developed to predict the accumulating process of the liquid-like contaminant oil air bearing surfaces. Numerical analysis of the behavior of the liquid-like adsorbed film for two different types of air bearing surfaces was conducted by using the proposed model based oil the Langmuir adsorption. The results show that the contaminant tends to accumulate on the recession area of the air bearing surface when the viscosity of the liquid-like adsorbed film is low. However it may also accumulate in the front area of the air bearing Surface when the viscosity is as high as 20 Pa s. (c) 2009 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.ja: Shear Stress Analysis of EHL Oil Films based on Thermal EHL Theory - In the Case of Elliptical Contact Condition -
paper_title.en: Shear Stress Analysis of EHL Oil Films Based on Thermal EHL Theory - In the Case of Elliptical Contact Condition -

description.ja: Under the elliptical contact conditions with an ellipticity parameter of Ke=1.4, a non-Newtonian thermal EHL analysis was carried out. The lubricating oil was assumed to behave as a Maxwell fluid. Lubricating oil is the automotive traction oil with the viscosity grade of ISO VG32. Input parameters are maximum Hertzian pressure PH=1.5 GPa, entrainment velocity ue=10 m/s, slide-roll ratio Σ=0%∼4.0% and inlet oil temperature t0=413 K. The shear stress distribution under elliptical contact conditions showed a similar tendency to that obtained in point contact conditions, and it was found that the traction coefficients at maximum Hertzian pressure of PH=1.5 GPa are scarcely affected by the shape of contact area. Furthermore, although both the pressure distributions and the temperature distributions hardly changed up to the slide-roll ratio of Σ=1.0%, the considerable variation in the shear stress distributions was recognized.
description.en: Under the elliptical contact conditions with an ellipticity parameter of Ke=1.4, a non-Newtonian thermal EHL analysis was carried out. The lubricating oil was assumed to behave as a Maxwell fluid. Lubricating oil is the automotive traction oil with the viscosity grade of ISO VG32. Input parameters are maximum Hertzian pressure PH=1.5 GPa, entrainment velocity ue=10 m/s, slide-roll ratio Σ=0%∼4.0% and inlet oil temperature t0=413 K. The shear stress distribution under elliptical contact conditions showed a similar tendency to that obtained in point contact conditions, and it was found that the traction coefficients at maximum Hertzian pressure of PH=1.5 GPa are scarcely affected by the shape of contact area. Furthermore, although both the pressure distributions and the temperature distributions hardly changed up to the slide-roll ratio of Σ=1.0%, the considerable variation in the shear stress distributions was recognized.

paper_title.en: The effect of air shear force moment on the performance of slider air bearings in hard disk drives

description.en: The shear force moment was included in the design model of air bearings for hard disk drives, and the effect of the shear force moment was investigated with some numerical results. It was found that the shear force moment tends to increase the load capacity and reduce the pitch angle of the air bearing. It is concluded that the shear force moment must be incorporated into the design model of air bearings of hard disk drives.

publication_name.en: PROCEEDINGS OF THE INSTITUTION OF MECHANICAL ENGINEERS PART J-JOURNAL OF ENGINEERING TRIBOLOGY

paper_title.en: The effect of air shear force moment on the performance of slider air bearings in hard disk drives

paper_title.ja: Shear Stress Analysis of EHL Oil Films based on Thermal EHL Theory - Effect of Inlet Oil Temperature -
paper_title.en: Shear Stress Analysis of EHL Oil Films Based on Thermal EHL Theory - Effect of Inlet Oil Temperature -

description.ja: Under the same EHL contact conditions as in the traction experiments carried out by Wedeven et al., the authors performed a non-Newtonian thermal EHL analysis. In the present analysis, the lubricating oil was assumed to behave as a Maxwell fluid. Lubricating oil is the automotive traction oil with the viscosity grade of ISO VG32. Input parameters are maximum Hertzian pressure PH=1.5 GPa, entrainment velocity ue=10 m/s, slide-roll ratio ∑=0%∼4.0% and inlet oil temperature t0=313 K∼413 K. The Eyring stress, the elastic shear modulus and the limiting shear stress which are needed to calculate the shear stress components were obtained from reference traction curves. The traction coefficients obtained by the numerical analysis agreed well with the measured values in traction experiments. Furthermore, it was found that the shear stress distribution is affected not only by the inlet oil temperature but also by the rolling-sliding conditions.
description.en: Under the same EHL contact conditions as in the traction experiments carried out by Wedeven et al., the authors performed a non-Newtonian thermal EHL analysis. In the present analysis, the lubricating oil was assumed to behave as a Maxwell fluid. Lubricating oil is the automotive traction oil with the viscosity grade of ISO VG32. Input parameters are maximum Hertzian pressure PH=1.5 GPa, entrainment velocity ue=10 m/s, slide-roll ratio ∑=0%∼4.0% and inlet oil temperature t0=313 K∼413 K. The Eyring stress, the elastic shear modulus and the limiting shear stress which are needed to calculate the shear stress components were obtained from reference traction curves. The traction coefficients obtained by the numerical analysis agreed well with the measured values in traction experiments. Furthermore, it was found that the shear stress distribution is affected not only by the inlet oil temperature but also by the rolling-sliding conditions.

paper_title.en: Application of Thermally Sprayed WC Cermet Coating on Steel Substrate
Effects of substrate surface finish and substrate material on durability of thermally sprayed WC cermet coating in rolling with sliding contact

description.en: In this study, using a two-roller testing machine, the authors examined the surface durability of thermally sprayed WC-Cr-Ni cermet coating in lubricated rolling with sliding contact conditions. The coating was formed onto the axially ground, blasted and circumferentially ground roller specimens made of a thermally refined carbon steel or an induction hardened carbon steel by means of the high energy type flame spraying (Hi-HVOF) method. The WC cermet coated roller finished to a mirror-like condition was mated with the carburized steel roller without coating having a surface roughness of Ry=3.0 similar to 5.0 mu m. In the experiments, a maximum Hertzian stress Of P-H =0.6 or 0.8 GPa was applied for the thermally refined carbon steel roller and P-H = 1.4 GPa was applied for the induction hardened carbon steel roller in line contact condition. As a result, it was found that in the case of induction hardened steel substrate, the coated roller generally exhibits a long life without any serious damage and the surface durability is hardly affected by the substrate surface finish, while in the case of thermally refined steel substrate, the durability of coated roller is lowered and the life to flaking is very short particularly when the substrate surface is circumferentially ground and the mating surface is rough. The surface durability of coated roller was also compared with the durability of steel roller without coating. Finally, in order to discuss the durability of coated roller, the elastic-plastic behavior of the subsurface layer under repeated rolling with sliding contact was analyzed using a finite element method (FEM). (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Effects of substrate surface finish and substrate material on durability of thermally sprayed WC cermet coating in rolling with sliding contact

description.en: In this study, using a two-roller testing machine, the authors examined the surface durability of thermally sprayed WC-Cr-Ni cermet coating in lubricated rolling with sliding contact conditions. The coating was formed onto the axially ground, blasted and circumferentially ground roller specimens made of a thermally refined carbon steel or an induction hardened carbon steel by means of the high energy type flame spraying (Hi-HVOF) method. The WC cermet coated roller finished to a mirror-like condition was mated with the carburized steel roller without coating having a surface roughness of Ry=3.0 similar to 5.0 mu m. In the experiments, a maximum Hertzian stress Of P-H =0.6 or 0.8 GPa was applied for the thermally refined carbon steel roller and P-H = 1.4 GPa was applied for the induction hardened carbon steel roller in line contact condition. As a result, it was found that in the case of induction hardened steel substrate, the coated roller generally exhibits a long life without any serious damage and the surface durability is hardly affected by the substrate surface finish, while in the case of thermally refined steel substrate, the durability of coated roller is lowered and the life to flaking is very short particularly when the substrate surface is circumferentially ground and the mating surface is rough. The surface durability of coated roller was also compared with the durability of steel roller without coating. Finally, in order to discuss the durability of coated roller, the elastic-plastic behavior of the subsurface layer under repeated rolling with sliding contact was analyzed using a finite element method (FEM). (c) 2005 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Pumping effect of sliders in hard disk systems

description.en: The accumulation of contaminants on the slider surface is of paramount importance in hard disk drives because only an ultra small amount of contaminants on the slider surface will cause catastrophic failures for hard disk drives with a spacing between the slider and the hard disk as small as 10 nm, which will be reduced further in the near future to about 5-6 nm in order to attain a recording density of 100 Gbit/in(2). In this paper the pumping effect of the slider is proposed as one mechanism of the contaminant accumulation on the slider. Analysis of the pumping effect is conducted by considering the adsorption process and the shear flow process on the slider surface in terms of the continuum. It is found that the pumping effect can be divided into two different classifications depending on the value of the parameter lambda which is the ratio of the maximum shear flow of the adsorbed film to the maximum adsorption amount: the shear flow rate-controlling pumping effect for lambda < 0.1 and the adsorption rate-controlling pumping effect for lambda > 0.4. For the shear flow rate-controlling effect, the accumulation rate of the contaminant is directly proportional to the disk surface velocity, while inversely proportional to the flying height of the slider.

paper_title.en: Pumping effect of sliders in hard disk systems

description.en: The accumulation of contaminants on the slider surface is of paramount importance in hard disk drives because only an ultra small amount of contaminants on the slider surface will cause catastrophic failures for hard disk drives with a spacing between the slider and the hard disk as small as 10 nm, which will be reduced further in the near future to about 5-6 nm in order to attain a recording density of 100 Gbit/in(2). In this paper the pumping effect of the slider is proposed as one mechanism of the contaminant accumulation on the slider. Analysis of the pumping effect is conducted by considering the adsorption process and the shear flow process on the slider surface in terms of the continuum. It is found that the pumping effect can be divided into two different classifications depending on the value of the parameter lambda which is the ratio of the maximum shear flow of the adsorbed film to the maximum adsorption amount: the shear flow rate-controlling pumping effect for lambda < 0.1 and the adsorption rate-controlling pumping effect for lambda > 0.4. For the shear flow rate-controlling effect, the accumulation rate of the contaminant is directly proportional to the disk surface velocity, while inversely proportional to the flying height of the slider.

research_project_title.ja: 熱弾性流体潤滑理論に基づくEHL油膜のせん断応力解析

description.ja: 潤滑油の非ニュートン性を考慮するため，EyringモデルとMaxwellモデルを適用した一般化レイノルズ式およびエネルギー式による熱弾性流体潤滑解析を行い，接触面間に形成されるEHL油膜内部のせん断応力分布が滑り率と入口温度によりどのような影響を受けるのかを調査する．

research_project_title.ja: ボールねじの玉の運動挙動と運転性能に関する研究

description.ja: 保持ピースが組み込まれたボールねじにアキシアル方向の荷重を負荷した場合，玉の運動挙動，玉と転送面間のEHL油膜形成状態，ボールねじの振動などにどのような影響を及ぼすのかについて調査する．また，同形式で総玉仕様のボールねじを用いた実験結果との比較を行い，保持ピースの影響についても検討する．

research_project_title.ja: 先進材料の転がり疲れ強度に関する研究

description.ja: 新たに開発された熱間圧延用ロール材の転がり接触下での耐久性を調査するために，鏡面に仕上げられた超硬ローラを，軸受鋼ローラと組合せて二円筒試験を行い，摩耗や損傷発生状況を調べるとともに，ハイス材ならびにNi－グレン材ローラを用いた実験結果との差異について検討する．

research_project_title.ja: 溶射皮膜の転がり疲れ強度

description.ja: S45C調質材および高周波焼入れ材の鋼製ローラ表面に高速フレーム溶射法を用いてWCサーメット皮膜をコーティングし，浸炭焼入れ鋼ローラを相手に，鉱油潤滑下または無給油での転がり－滑り試験を行い，溶射皮膜の耐久性を調査する．

research_project_title.ja: 転がり軸受における転動体の三次元運動と運転性能に関する研究

description.ja: 高速運転下におけるアンギュラ玉軸受の玉の三次元運動挙動を，軸受内部に組み込まれた磁化玉と静止斜交座標系に配置したホール素子により計測するとともに，玉と転送面間に形成されるEHL油膜の形成状態や軸受外輪温度との関係を調べる．

research_project_title.ja: 接触面の三次元計測とキャラクタリゼーション

description.ja: 摩耗や塑性変形による転がり接触面のミクロな形状変化を，同一箇所を繰り返し精度よく測定できるよう工夫された三次元粗さ測定により計測するとともに,粗さ突起の接触の過酷度を示す塑性指数により，運転によるなじみの進行を追跡・評価する．

research_project_title.ja: 高硬度材の転がり疲れに関する研究

description.ja: SUJ2軸受鋼やSCM415浸炭鋼ローラを用いた二円筒試験を行い，転がり疲れ損傷の発生状況を調査するとともに，粗さ組合せや滑り率，潤滑油種などが高硬度材の転がり疲れ寿命に与える影響をについて検討する．
